articles.title: ‘Deforestation, exploitation of wildlife leads to pandemics like Covid-19’: Epidemiologist - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Because the world is more interconnected than ever through travel and trade, it is likely that we will see pandemics at an increasing rate, says Dr Pranav Pandit, a veterinary epidemiologist.
articles.content:
New research has confirmed that Sars-Cov-2 is very closely genetically related to coronaviruses from bat populations, and specifically rhinolophus bats, and pangolins may have been intermediate hosts in transmission to humans.

articles.title: Commentary: Infecting volunteers with COVID-19 may speed up vaccine development - CNA
articles.description: The idea of intentionally infecting people in the quest for a vaccine is not alien to medical research, says Anjana Ahuja.
articles.content:
LONDON: Josh Morrison, a former corporate lawyer in New York, wants to be deliberately exposed to coronavirus. 
He hit on the idea after reading a scientific paper suggesting that infecting volunteers could speed up vaccine development.
